sense.gloss: to go out to meet, to receive, to welcome, to greet, to salute, to hail
to call for, to summon, to invite
to accept (e.g. as a member of a group or family), to take (e.g. a wife)
to reach (a certain time, a point in one's life, etc.), to enter (a new phase, new era, etc.), to approach (e.g. death)
receiving, welcoming, going to meet, person sent to meet or pick up someone
final call, call of fate, approach of death
seeing off and meeting on return
ingratiation, pandering, catering (to), going along with (someone or something), accommodating oneself (e.g. to public opinion)
deuteragonist, secondary or supporting actor in a noh or kyogen play (possibly multiple actors)
seeing (or dropping) off, then later picking up or going to meet (the same person)

sdata.j: どこに↑行↑↓い↓っても、↑歓迎↑↓かんげい↓されるよ。
sdata.e: Wherever you go, you'll be welcomed.

sdata.j: ↑空港↑↓くうこう↓まで↑父↑↓ちち↓を↑迎↑↓むか↓えに↑行↑↓い↓きました。
sdata.e: I went to the airport to meet my father.

sdata.j: ↑空港↑↓くうこう↓まで↑迎↑↓むか↓えの↑車↑↓くるま↓を↑出↑↓だ↓すように↑手配↑↓てはい↓した。
sdata.e: I arranged for a car to meet you at the airport.

sdata.j: ↑空港↑↓くうこう↓へあなたを↑迎↑↓むか↓えに↑行↑↓い↓けたのに。
sdata.e: I could've met you at the airport.

sdata.j: ↑家族↑↓かぞく↓を↑空港↑↓くうこう↓に↑迎↑↓むか↓えに↑行↑↓い↓かなくては。
sdata.e: I have to go to the airport to meet my family.

sdata.j: ↑空港↑↓くうこう↓に↑５↑↓ご↓↑時↑↓じ↓に↑迎↑↓むか↓えに↑来↑↓き↓てください。
sdata.e: Please pick me up at the airport at five.

sdata.j: ↑空港↑↓くうこう↓からホテルまでの↑送迎↑↓そうげい↓バスはありますか。
sdata.e: Is there a shuttle bus between the hotel and airport?

sdata.j: ↑金↑↓きむ↓はどこでも↑歓迎↑↓かんげい↓される。
↑急病↑↓きゅうびょう↓のために、↑私↑↓わたし↓は↑彼↑↓かれ↓の↑出迎↑↓でむか↓えに↑駅↑↓えき↓に↑行↑↓い↓けなかった。
sdata.e: A sudden illness prevented me from going to the station to meet him.

sdata.j: ↑客↑↓きゃく↓たちは↑暖↑↓あたた↓かい↑握手↑↓あくしゅ↓で↑迎↑↓むか↓えられた。
sdata.e: The visitors were greeted with warm handshakes.

words.gloss: to go out to meet, to receive, to welcome, to greet, to salute, to hail
